page.title: 08AGRICULTURAL WAGES
page.content:
THE SCOTTISH AGRICULTURAL WAGES BOARD PROPOSE TO MAKE A NEW ORDER FOR THE WHOLE OF SCOTLAND WHICH WILL COME INTO OPERATION ON 2nd. SEPTEMBER 1985. WAGES DEPEND ON WHETHER QUALIFICATIONS HAVE BEEN OBTAINED FOLLOWING A PERIOD OF TRAINING UNDER AN APPROVED TRAINING SCHEME. JOB WEEKLY WAGES (Â£) UNTRAINED TRAINED GENERAL WORKER 89.20 99.90 SHEPHERDS 107.75 STOCKWORKERS 107.75 TRACTOR & HORSEWORKERS 99.90
ACCORDING TO A LOCAL FARMER, R.MILLAR,BALCALK,LOCAL RATES OF PAY TEND TO BE SLIGHTLY HIGHER THAN THE NATIONAL FIGURES QUOTED ABOVE.
